<<<<<<< HEAD
Charles R. Charles by the grace of God, king of Scotland, England, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith. To our lovits [blank] maissars ... greeting. Whereas for the removing of the disorders ... Proclamations. 1638-12-08 Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
[2], 14 p.
By Robert Young, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie. Cum privilegio, [Imprinted at Edinburgh : Anno 1638]
Against acknowledging the Glasgow Assembly. Dated at end: Given .. the eighth day of December .. 1638. Title from opening words of text, A2r; imprint from A1r. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[2], 14 p.

Against acknowledging the Glasgow Assembly. Dated at end: Given .. the eighth day of December .. 1638. Title from opening words of text, A2r; imprint from A1r. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
